channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for SC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for SC

item.title: Report E-2024100382
item.description:
Report E-2024100382

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-10
  • City: DUNCAN
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During a routine vehicle inspection at the job site, Veolia employees discovered paint dripping from a drum. Upon investigation, they determined that the leaking drum had been collected from a previous customer, Hentzen. The employees located the source of the leak, which was coming from the top of the drum. After a thorough inspection, the seal was identified as the cause of the problem. The employees theorized that the truck's vibration during transport had caused the paint to seep through the faulty top seal. Fortunately, the spill was contained within the truck, and no paint had leaked outside while the vehicle was in motion. The team took immediate action to address the situation. They contained the spill and overpacked the drum, along with all materials used in the cleanup process. This prompt response ensured that the incident was managed efficiently and safely, minimizing any potential environmental impact or further complications.

item.title: Report E-2024090490
item.description:
Report E-2024090490

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-17T09:14:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: Charleston
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 09/20/2024, at 0857 hours, CSX personnel reported UTLX 208840, a loaded tank car containing Alcohols, N.O.S., leaking from top of the tank car. The car was isolated and the shipper, Poet Bioprocessing, was notified via Ambipar (Report #20240920-01-02787). CSX Senior Manager of Hazardous Materials Rob James responded to the scene and found five of eight manway cover bolts less than tool tight. Mr. James inspected the car to ensure there were no notable defects to the manway cover, gasket, or nozzle, and secured all manway cover bolts tool tight to secure the product release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- Jared Ayers (316-213-2805). Upon proper securement the car was released for transportation.
